title: 108_s35
content: The Act titled "Emergency Unemployment Compensation Act of 2003" extends the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002. Section 208 of the latter Act is amended to specify its applicability. The Emergency Unemployment Compensation Act of 2003 extends the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002. An agreement under this title applies to unemployment weeks starting after the agreement date and ending before June 1, 2003. Transition rules apply for individuals with remaining amounts in their account after May 31, 2003. The amendment made by this section under the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Act of 2003 states that if an individual's account is exhausted after May 31, 2003, certain provisions shall not apply, and no compensation shall be payable for weeks beginning after December 31, 2003. The effective date of this amendment is retroactive to the enactment of the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002. SEC. 3. ENTITLEMENT TO ADDITIONAL WEEKS OF TEMPORARY EXTENDED UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to provide additional weeks of benefits equal to 26 times the individual's weekly benefit amount. The effective date for these amendments applies to weeks of unemployment starting on or after a specified date. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to provide additional weeks of benefits starting on a specified date. Eligibility for additional weeks of benefits applies to individuals who exhausted their rights to previous compensation before January 1, 2003. The Act amendments apply to weeks of unemployment after enactment. Nonexhaustees before 2003 may be eligible for extended benefits. The Act amendments apply to weeks of unemployment after December 29, 2002. Determination of eligibility for augmented benefits for exhaustees is made without considering previous determinations under the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002. The Act amendments apply to individuals who did not receive augmented benefits before the changes made by this Act or when their account is exhausted under the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002.
